alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Nacogdoches; Rusk (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Rusk, northwestern Nacogdoches, northwestern Angelina and southeastern Cherokee Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 417 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Sacul to 6 miles southwest of Morrill. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alto, Wells, Morrill, Pollok, Sacul, Forest, Douglass, Trawick, Cushing, Reklaw, Lilbert, Linwood and Looneyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for northeastern Texas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for eastern and northeastern Texas.
